ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: Approximately 5 hours per week.
2 hours
Usually I spent 1 hours per week for course readings and videos.
1-2 hours
3-4 hours per week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Extremely insightful course on relevant topics in genetics; may be interesting to learn more about current lab techniques
This course was exceptional. It provided an excellent background in genetics and covered the current issues and related developments. I am very glad I had the opportunity to take this course.
I like this course. Dr. Hoh is creative and makes the course attractive.
In this course, we learned a lot of cases in genetics and I also enjoyed the video that the professor provided to us.
class broad my view and knowledge in genetic field
The small and intimate size of this course fostered compelling discussions of genetics. This is a feature that I have not found in other courses.
I learnt a lot

I thought this course was great. It was really insightful into some hot technologies currently being used in science and their applications. We also learned about various diseases and their genetic relationships. I learned so much!

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Josephine Hoh  Excellent professor who is always open to helping her students; acts with kindness and positivity; her class was truly the best part of my week

Instructor: Josephine Hoh  Professor Hoh is a phenomenal instructor who genuinely cares about the topic and her students. She does a great job of conveying the course material in a relevant and understandable manner.
Instructor: Josephine Hoh  She is an excellent and charming professor.

Instructor: Josephine Hoh  Dr. Hoh is an intelligent professor and very nice to all of students. I really like her idea about this course that she wants to show us the case studies around the world and what are the current trend of genetics studies, which I believe it could help us for future study.
Instructor: Josephine Hoh  she is excellent, responsible and helpful
Instructor: Josephine Hoh  She brings an energy to this course that is refreshing. Her genuine interest in helping the students was apparent from the first class.
Instructor: Josephine Hoh  good. Professor Hoh provided us lots of cutting-edge information.

Instructor: Josephine Hoh  Dr. Hoh is an amazing professor! She truly cares about her students and ensures that we learn about the latest technologies in the field and their applications. She made the course very engaging and interactive.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Excellent course and would like to see it again; Dr. Hoh is an incredible teacher

Take this course. The title may be intimidating for those who do not have a background in public health or genetics, but it is interesting, understandable and pertinent. I learned A LOT but never felt overwhelmed by the course load.
You can learn a lot of new things in this creative course.
I recommend this course for other students who wants to learn more about genetics.
recommended

I would recommend this course to a fellow student. This course allows for students to explore genetics in a public health context. It is not just an overview but rather, a semester-long in-depth conversation.
good
I recommend taking this class and any offered by Dr. Hoh!
